snippet: The telephone company also warned that its fourth-quarter earnings would be depressed by high smartphone costs and damage from Hurricane Sandy.
abstract: AT&T warns that it will take fourth-quarter charge of about $10 billion due to bigger-than-expected pension obligations; shares fall 1.7 percent on news.
lead_paragraph: The telephone company also warned that its fourth-quarter earnings would be depressed by high smartphone costs and damage from Hurricane Sandy.

headline.seo: AT&T Warns of $10 Billion Fourth-Quarter Charge for Pension Costs
headline.main: AT&T Will Take a Charge of $10 Billion for Pension Costs
headline.print_headline: AT&T Will Take a Charge of $10 Billion for Pension Costs
